groupHeaders: On a scale of 0 - 10, if 0 represents the most uncomfortable socket fit you can imagine, and 10 represents the most comfortable socket fit:
instructions: Ask the patient to rate the comfort of his/her socket on a 0 to 10 scale where 0 represents the most uncomfortable and 10 represents the most comfortable socket imaginable.
overview: The Socket Comfort Score (SCS) is a self-reporting tool that uses an 11-point numerical rating scale specifically validated for assessment of prosthetic socket fit and comfort.
population: The intended population includes the following condition: Prosthesis Users.
references: 1. Hanspal RS, Fisher K, Nieveen R. Prosthetic socket fit comfort score. Disabil Rehabil. 2003 Nov 18;25(22):1278-80. doi: 10.1080/09638280310001603983. PMID: 14617445.
score_calculation: The score is reported as the whole number response.
